Introduction
As computers became more advanced, the need to structure data arise, files were invented. A file was, and still is, a sequence of data (bits/bytes) associated with a name (the filename). But people soon realised that wasn't enough, and the concept of directories were added. Instead of storing all files on the same place, files were grouped up together in directories. It was also possible to store directories in directories (often called sub-directories), making the possibilities virtually endless.
The concepts with files and directories is used in almost all computer systems today, and chaos will use a similiar system. This document defines how files and directories should be structured in chaos.
